metadata.title: CVE-2023-29550 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
Memory safety bugs present in Firefox 111 and Firefox ESR 102.9. Some ofthese bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that withenough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrarycode. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 112, Focus for Android < 112,Firefox ESR < 102.10, Firefox for Android < 112, and Thunderbird < 102.10.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-29550` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

libmozjs-102-0 - 102.11.0-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
mozjs78 package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs102 package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '102.11.0-0ubuntu0.23.04.1').
